metadata.title: Footprints in the cotton fields: The Industrial Revolution as time space appropriation and -environmental load displacement

relevance.topic: Industrial Revolution and its impact on labor and environment
relevance.relevance: The study is relevant as it examines the displacement of labor and environmental loads due to technological advancements during the Industrial Revolution, particularly in the British textile industry.

dependent_variables.displaced: Displacement of fiber production to North America

qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study provides a narrative on how the British textile industry's success was built on the displacement of labor and environmental loads to other regions, particularly North America.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of industrialization and economic growth in Britain
historical_context.institutional_context: Colonial trade policies and global economic relations

outcomes.main_findings: The study finds that the British textile industry's success was largely due to the displacement of labor and environmental loads to other regions, particularly North America.
outcomes.conclusions: Technological advancements during the Industrial Revolution led to significant labor displacement and environmental load displacement, contributing to unequal global exchanges.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: The study suggests that the patterns of resource exchange established during the Industrial Revolution have continued to reinforce themselves, contributing to ongoing global inequalities.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical data which may have limitations in accuracy and completeness.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a coherent analysis of the relationship between technological change and labor displacement.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The data used is adequate for the historical analysis conducted, though some figures are approximations.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is highly relevant to understanding the historical context of labor displacement due to technological change.
